summary: 01/17/1993: Members of Resistenza set fire to 20 holiday homes in Porto-Vecchio and Bonifacio, Corsica, France. No one was injured in the attacks however many of the homes were damaged. The group also attacked homes in Bonifacio, Corsica.
target1: Holiday Homes in Porto-Vecchio, Corsica, France
propcomment: The homes sustained some fire damage.
addnotes: This is one of two related attacks (cf. 199301170003 - 04).  The letter "R" was sprayed on the smoke-blackened walls of bungalows, show villas and other holiday homes. A war had started between Resistenza and the National Liberation Front of Corsica (FLNC), which are rival factions, with Resistenza trying to outdo the FLNC. Both groups set fire to homes on 01/1719/93 (cf. 199301170005)
scite1: “Around the World,” The Ottawa Citizen, January 19, 1993.
scite2: Tony Rocca, “Separatist Blitz Rocks Corsica,” The Guardian (London), January 19, 1993.
scite3: Tony Rocca, “Separatist Gangs Attack 40 Homes on Corsica,” The Gazette (Montreal, Quebec) (Montreal, Quebec), January 19, 1993.
